content.title: Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm
content.description: False aneurysm of visceral arteries, often secondary to pancreatitis, trauma, or iatrogenic injury.

clinical_features.presentation: May present with GI bleeding, intraperitoneal hemorrhage, or hemobilia

treatment.endovascular_preferred: Coil embolization is first-line for most pseudoaneurysms

content.clinical_pearl: Unlike true aneurysms, pseudoaneurysms have no waiting period - treat promptly due to high rupture risk
content.statement: Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
